title: The Top 10 Funniest Cat Videos On YouTube
summary: Maru: Master of the Vertical Jump - This little Scottish Fold kitty from Japan is a real star. Shiba Confessionals - Definitely not for the faint of heart! Kitten Wars - Kitten humor mixed with a dash of cringe Kitty make-up sessions with Blink Beauty. Jumping Cats â€“ Normal Cat Behavior Explained - It's not what you think! intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Why do crazy cat people love their cats so much? Because their cats are hilarious. With their constant sneering and condescending glares, feline friends have a knack for being entertaining in the most ridiculous ways. So, if you need a break from those stressful final exam cram sessions, we've compiled a list of the top 10 funniest cat videos on YouTube. From silly cats to crafty cats and everything in between, these videos will give you some much-needed LOLs.
Cat videos are one of the most popular video niches online today. There are several channels on YouTube that are dedicated only to cat videos and nothing else. In this post we\u2019ll look at some of the best channels that feature nothing but cat content \u2013 be it funny cat vines or cute cat compilations \u2013 as well as some of our favorite individual clips from these creators.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog to Accept Being Left Alone

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,'As much as we love our dogs, and vice versa, no one likes the dreaded "crap, I have to go back to work" feeling. Putting your dog in a boarding facility or kennel isn\u2019t an easy decision for most pet owners, especially if you have a sensitive breed (i.e., lots of barking = unhappy dogs). So how can you get your pup ready to be on their own? It\u2019s not as simple as locking them in a closet for a few hours once or twice and then expecting them to be cool with it. Dogs don\u2019t think like people; they don\u2019t understand symbolic actions like turning off the light as meaning that you won\u2019t be coming back home tonight. They have instinctual fear responses that need to be addressed specifically with training and care before leaving them alone.'))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog Not to Jump on People

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Do you have friends who are scared of dogs? Or perhaps you just don\u2019t want your dog jumping up on people. Whatever the case, teaching your dog to not jump up on people is an essential skill. It can also be tricky because it requires reading your dog and anticipating their behavior. If they haven\u2019t jumped yet, will they leap again? Will they creep towards you first or wait for you to move closer first? The answer may be different every time and that\u2019s why it can feel like a constant guessing game. However, with persistence and patience, you can train your dog to not jump on people.
If your dog is prone to jumping, it\u2019s important to manage that behavior before moving onto this training program. Dogs commonly jump for one of three reasons: They are excited and overstimulated; they want something from you such as food or attention; or they see it as a way of getting nearer to something else (this could be either the person you don\u2019t want them leaping at or something else nearby).`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog to Walk on a Leash
How to Start Living a More Eco-Friendly Lifestyle

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Did you know that a single person produces about 1.6 tons of CO2 per year? Did you also know that producing one cotton t-shirt uses almost 19 gallons of water and produces 3.5lbs of CO2?"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog to Not Beg at the Table

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`You probably wouldn\u2019t sit down to a meal with your dog at the table every day, but that doesn\u2019t mean you can\u2019t enjoy a nice home-cooked meal with your pup. Dogs are social animals, so they love spending time with their owners and other people. But they also have their weird quirks, like begging at the table or jumping up to get snacks.
Luckily, it\u2019s not hard to train your dog to stop begging at the table and other bad habits. They just take some patience and dedication to follow through on commands until your dog gets it. With these tips, you can crack down on those weird doggy habits and help them learn new things that will last a lifetime. Read on for advice on how to train your dog to stop begging at the table and other tricks as well as tricks from nutritionist Victoria SchENDler`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 50 Ways to Keep the Spark Alive in Your Relationship
How to Train Your Dog to Allow You to Groom Them

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Dogs are often seen as low-maintenance pets. While this is true in a lot of cases, it\u2019t necessarily the case all the time. Depending on your dog\u2019s breed and their natural instincts, you might find that grooming them can prove to be a very tricky task. If you have struggled to get your dog used to being groomed for some time now, there are several tips and tricks you can use to help train them to allow you to do so.
Dog grooming is something that many pet owners struggle with from time to time, especially if your pet has a specific type of fur that doesn\u2019t grow too much like long hair or curly hair. It\u2019s natural for dogs to dislike having their hair caught in things like bushes or trees while they hunt or run around outside; however, it can also be difficult when trying to keep their hair short and tidy at home.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Deal with a Partner Who's Always Busy
How to Make Time for Your Hobbies

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"When you love something, it feels like there\u2019s not enough time in the day to do everything you want to do. But at the same time, when you don\u2019t have anything that fills your days with joy and meaning, it feels like there are not enough hours in a week. Many people struggle with finding time for their hobbies. They either feel too busy or believe that they simply don\u2019t have the opportunities to pursue something they enjoy. This feeling is understandable\u2014because most people lead incredibly busy lives. Work, school, family, friends, and other obligations take up a lot of time and energy. So how can you carve out some time for your hobbies? It might seem impossible right now\u2014but trust us, it\u2019s possible! Even if your schedule feels full beyond measure right now, there are always little cracks of space that can grow and expand into larger windows of opportunity."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Deal with Trust Issues in Relationships

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you first start dating someone, trust probably isn\u2019t the biggest issue on your mind. You\u2019re getting to know this person and trying to figure out if there might be a potential future with them or not. However, once you get into a relationship with this person and things get more serious, trust can very quickly become an issue.
Even if you don\u2019t trust someone right away, that doesn\u2019t mean the trust issues don\u2019t come up later on. It may take time for them to make you feel uneasy or distrustful of your partner. But it also could be something that crops up almost immediately \u2013 especially if you meet them in a place like a nightclub, bar or other place where people tend to hookup without much thought as to who they\u2019re hooking up with! This article will offer some tips on how to deal with these trust issues in relationships and help resolve any problems from arising in the first place.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
